meanings.definition: To carry or drag something heavy or awkward.
meanings.sent1: I had to lug my heavy backpack up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The movers had to lug the piano across the room.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see the tiny dog trying to lug the giant bone.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to lug the weight of the world on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to lug the massive statue carefully through the narrow hallway.

meanings.definition: A projecting piece used for lifting or carrying heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The suitcase had a sturdy lug for easy lifting.
meanings.sent2: The crane operator attached the hook to the lug on the container.
meanings.sent3: The lug on the toolbox made it convenient to carry around.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the lug that helped him overcome the obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The lug on the bucket made it easier to pour out the water.

meanings.definition: A handle or strap for carrying something.
meanings.sent1: She grabbed the lug of the bag and lifted it off the ground.
meanings.sent2: The lug on the bucket made it easier to transport water.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly pretended the lug of the briefcase was a sword.
meanings.sent4: The lug of the shopping bag dug into her palm as she carried it home.
meanings.sent5: The lug of the basket was worn from years of use but still strong.
